meanings.definition: People who watch or notice something.
meanings.sent1: The observers at the game cheered loudly for their team.
meanings.sent2: The wildlife observers spotted a rare bird in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The observers at the party couldn't stop laughing at the magician's tricks.
meanings.sent4: The security camera acted as a silent observer in the store.
meanings.sent5: The young girl was a keen observer of nature, always curious about the world around her.

meanings.definition: Devices or instruments used to monitor or track something.
meanings.sent1: The weather observers predicted a storm approaching the coast.
meanings.sent2: The traffic observers detected heavy congestion on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The fitness tracker was a helpful observer during the marathon.
meanings.sent4: The satellite acted as a vigilant observer of Earth's weather patterns.
meanings.sent5: The security cameras were reliable observers, ensuring the safety of the building.
